dimensions.description: The longitudinal (front to back/rear) position to where the opponent placed their shot and to where the player has to move to play their shot (from the player's perspective).

values.description: front third of the court, usually from net back to around the service line.
middle third of the court, usually from around the service line back to around or somewhat in front of the first back line (doubles service back line).
last (back) third of the court usually from around or somewhat in front of the first back line to the last back line (singles service back line).

dimensions.description: The lateral (side-to-side) position to where the opponent placed their shot and to where the player has to move to play their shot (from the player's perspective).

values.description: left area (around a quarter) of the court, usually from left (singles/doubles) side line to around half the distance to the middle line.
middle area of the court, usually half the distance to the left and right side lines from the middle line.
right area (around a quarter) of the court, usually from right (singles/doubles) side line to around half the distance to the middle line.

dimensions.description: The timing of when the player makes contact with the shuttle relative to optimal timing.

values.description: contact made earlier than optimal timing.
contact made at optimal timing.
contact made later than optimal timing.

dimensions.description: The tactical intention behind the shot being played.

values.description: shot intended to attack and put pressure on opponent.
shot intended to maintain rally without specific attack or defense.
shot intended to defend and recover from opponent's attack.

dimensions.description: The type of stroke technique used to hit the shuttle.

values.description: high, deep shot to the back of the court.
soft shot that falls close to the net.
hard, downward attacking shot.
moderate power downward shot.
fast, flat shot at net level.
controlled attacking shot to midcourt.
fast downward shot that ends the rally.

dimensions.description: The type of contact made with the shuttle affecting its flight characteristics.

values.description: clean, solid contact with the shuttle.
contact that imparts forward rotation (inside-out).
contact that imparts backward rotation (outside-in).
contact that cuts across the shuttle creating side spin.
contact that cuts across the shuttle in reverse direction.

dimensions.description: The directional target of where the shot is aimed on the opponent's court.

values.description: shot directed to the same side of the court.
shot directed diagonally across the court.
shot directed to the center area of the court.

shots.definition: A serve that barely clears the net and lands just inside the receiver's service court.
A serve used in doubles, using a quick flick of the wrist to send the shuttle high and deep.
A serve hit flat and fast, skimming low over the net.
A serve hit deep into the back boundary line of the receiver's court.
A serve that imparts spin to the shuttle, making it unpredictable to return.
A shot hit deep to the opponent's back boundary line. The high clear is a defensive shot, while the flatter attacking clear is used offensively.
A high, deep clear shot used to move the opponent back and gain time to recover position.
A clear hit with speed and flat trajectory to pressure the opponent.
A shot that sends the shuttle high and deep into the opponent's court.
A shot that sends the shuttle high and deep into the opponent's court.
A shot hit softly and with finesse to fall rapidly and close to the net on the opponent's side.
A deceptive shot where the shuttle is sliced with the racket to reduce its speed and alter its direction.
A shot hit softly and with finesse to fall rapidly and close to the net on the opponent's side.
Shot played from the forecourt close to the net that just clears the net and drops sharply.

A shot made from below and very close to the net, causing the shuttle to rise, just clear the net, and drop sharply down the other side; named because the shuttle's path resembles the shape of a hairpin.
A net shot with spin to the shuttle, making it unpredictable to return.
A hard-hit overhead shot that forces the shuttle sharply downward; badminton's primary attacking stroke.
A hard-hit overhead shot that forces the shuttle sharply downward; badminton's primary attacking stroke.
Fast, downward shot that cannot be returned; a 'putaway'.
An offensive shot played by pushing the shuttle with a controlled motion, usually from net to the opponent's midcourt or body.
A fast and low shot that makes a horizontal flight over the net.
A shot used to return a smash, directed softly and close to the net.
